explanations.reason: The paper focuses on developing a regime switching framework for computing Value at Risk (VaR) and Expected Shortfall (ES) measures in financial risk management. It discusses statistical models and distributions (Student-t distributions) to capture volatility clustering and higher moments variation. There is no mention or application of machine learning techniques, neural networks, or any other AI-related methods in the title or abstract. The content is purely within the domain of financial econometrics and risk measurement.
